intro: Aspilia asperrima, commonly known as the rough aspilia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple center. Aspilia asperrima is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to reseed itself, making it a common sight in its native habitat.
